headline: Grilled Asparagus
description: Grilled asparagus is easy to make in a matter of minutes for a simple summer side dish that allows the natural flavor of asparagus to shine.

video.description: Make the perfect spring side dish with grilled asparagus.
video.name: Grilled Asparagus

name: Grilled Asparagus

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat and lightly oil the grate.
Lightly coat the asparagus spears with olive oil. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Cook asparagus on the preheated grill, turning often until lightly charred and fork-tender about 3 to 5 minutes.

review.reviewBody: This is an awesome recipe it's simple clean easy to fix doesn't take many ingredients perfect to give to a friend
Easy to make and quick. I made it with some lemon juice, parmesan, garlic powder, and balsamic vinegar as well as mentioned in the comments. Simple, yet tasty and clean.
It was excellent! I also added garlic salt. ðŸ˜‹

I made this using a bit more olive oil; and, shaking the asparagus, olive oil, and salt-free seasoning blend together in a ziploc bag. Then, placing it on a rack in a half-sheet pan, and roasting. The result is delicious.

It actually takes a little bit longer than 2 or 3 minutes. No biggie that's just my experience. I probably cooked mine for around 5 minutes. It all is basically up to you how you want it cooked & for how long. Everyone has different preferences for their food. It was absolutely delicious in the end & that's really all that matters..... RIGHT. Give it a try, I'm pretty sure you'll enjoy yourself.

I made it for our dinner side yesterday and it was a big hit! I did the skewers as someone suggested and prior to that I put the asparagus in a zip lock bag with the olive oil, salt, pepper and garlic powder for about 30 minutes. The asparagus was tender, but crisp and the flavor was so good! I will have this all summer long!
Baked in 425 degree oven! PERFECT after 15-20 minutes!

Canâ€™t mess up perfection! Great results. Added some fresh grated cheese. Prior to final finishing in a hot skillet, i blanched the asparagus to maintain a bright green color that contrasted nicely with the light char on my veggies.
My daughter gave me the idea. Never thought to do it on the grill. I kicked it up a notch by grilling them in foil packages with Italian dressing. Yum Yum
We have made this many times and several different versions. We've used coconut oil, butter, avocado oil; added garlic, sesame seeds, sunflower seeds; cooked it on the grill and on the stove top.
Excellent!
Excellent! Added a little balsamic vinegar and garlic powder and took the invaluable tip to skewer and flip.
We loved it!!
Fantastic! Very Easy!
Added Parmesan and garlic powder, put in foil and hit the grill... Excellent!

This was really good! I left them on top of Reynolds wrap in the high heat side of grill and turned them at 3 min, but then let them cook 3-5 minutes more. 6-8 min total was just the right amount of crunch
This recipe is amazing and super easy thank you!

I usually bake our asparagus with a little parmesan on top but was feeling lazy and asked hubbs to throw it on the grill with the steak. I used the olive oil and seasoning from the recipe, but after reading reviews, added a dash of onion powder and extra roasted garlic powder. I left it to marinate for about 45 mins. We have a "deluxe broiler rack" for cooking burgers and fish over an open fire while camping, which I put the asparagus in. Hubbs said it was way easier and less time consuming than the bamboo skewers (which im sure work great). Love this, will make again!

Delicious! After a friend introduced us to grilled asparagus, I came on here to find a recipe to follow to prepare it at home. This is almost identical to what he told us. The only addition we used was garlic salt and we let them marinate for a couple hours. All 4 of us devoured them. This will be a new side in our rotation for sure!
Came out perfect. The only thing I added was a bit of lemon zest when done.
It was way to make all you need is olive oil , pepper and salt my family loves it

As my other reviews go, I drive a truck and try to eat healthy with simple to go meals / snacks. I whipped this recipe up and made it up as stated , it was good and makes a great snack even though it will be cold when I eat them .
Did it with no salt and pepper, but sprinkled with minced garlic or garlic powder, and a small amount of crushed red pepper.
Sprinkled Fresh Parmesan Cheese immediately upon removing from grill!!
Quick easy and delish! Pairs greatly with grilled steak and a glass of wine! Bon Appetit!
easy to make, i cut the asparagus ends, and then put them in a large plastic zip lock bag, add the ingredients, shake then into the oven!!! Yummy!
Used a little more olive oil to get good coating on all and fresh ground black pepper and sea salt. Delicious!
So simple and so good. I make extra to use in my omlett the next day! I use grill mats that makes it easier to cook.

Grilled asparagus is so delicious! We always buy steak when asparagus is cheap in the spring and season it to go with whatever steaks we are preparing. lemon pepper, balsamic, Montreal, and parmesan all taste great on charred 'gus'. Must have high heat if using infrared grill otherwise it's limp and has no crunch.
Added Mrs Dash Garlic and Herb instead of Salt and pepper.
Made it just the way the recipe explained. It was delicious
I have made this several times but I use nature's season and garlic power and it's the best. The garlic power brings put a fantastic flavor. Love it. I have also used zucchini and it's just as good.
Love this. So easy and grilled is so fast. My favorite way to prepare asparagus!
Love it... my favorite way to have asparagus... I've never eaten a lot of it because of it turning mushy but I love this ... tender but still crisp.
This is simple and delicious. I recommend grilling over a wood fired pit, to get that off-the-charts flavor.
Awesome!

I made this for our first grill meal and it was by far the best asparagus ever! It was done before the other grill items so I did the foil to keep warm, this made it. It sat in the olive oil and salt & pepper. Out of this world. I did do one thing different, I used the Himalayan salt block to prepare and it gave an amazing flavor. I also believe in organic asparagus.
So simple and tasty.
came out great! cooks quickly! So be sure ya have your grilling timing down. Thank you :)
it was awesome. my favorite veg made better in heavon
The grilled asparagus was delicious . The recipe was very easy to follow.
I will make this often just because it's so easy
Easy and absolutely delicious exactly as it is!
Love it! Iâ€™m a huge asparagus fan after doing this recipe! Fast, simple and super tasty!
I also put Parm at the end, great.

I did this and the asperigus was perfect. In hot weather it is better than cooking inside.
It is so easy!!
Turned out well.
I also used coursely-ground pepper with a little kosher salt. My husband cringes at the thought of "asparagus" being near his food so I placed them in a 'grilling basket'
I would 100% make these again. this was my first time using the grill and it was very successful.
Replaced salt with Seasoning Salt fro a bit more flavour, came out perfect!
I use sesame oil, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, pepper and sprinkle with sesame seeds for an Asian flair. My go-to side year-round.
Used salt pepper olive oil balsamic and garlic. Grilled or smoked. Wonderful
9 year old and hubby raved. 5 year old would not touch.

SUPER Recipe
Super delicious, super easy and super nutritious !
This was the first time Iâ€™ve tried grilling asparagus. It couldnâ€™t have been easier or tastier as is. Itâ€™s also a basic recipe that is easy to change up a bit, depending on your taste buds the day you make. Feel like some heat (and lots of people do), sprinkle on some red or cayenne pepper. Want a little Italian flavor? Garlic powder and/or some oregano will be delicious. Any spice you like can be sprinkled in as lightly or heavily as you like!
I added a little garlic powder, which I love. It made a very simple, tasty recipe even better.
I put Italian season on them, it was very good
delicious and easy
Always tastes great grilled, substitute grated or shredded Asiago cheese for less salt to add a bit more flavor. It's always a favorite!
Simple and delicious as is!

I made this almost per the recipe and we loved it. We do love the natural flavors of our veggies though. I didn't measure the salt or pepper. I just sprinkled them on. I didn't have olive oil so I used cooking spray and it worked just fine. I am definitely making this again. I had it as a side and grilled steaks and made brown rice. We loved it!
I will make it again. I just added more Olive Oil because my batch was bigger

Absolutely delicious and so simple!! Use a slotted grill pan for your grill and you won't have to worry about spears falling through the grate. Also you won't have to mess with skewer's. Get a non-stick one!
Fresh, easy, healthy and delicious! I love asparagus.

I used garlic olive oil instead of regular olive oil to add garlic flavor - very good! You could add minced garlic to the mix and use regular olive oil instead. I let them marinade for about 30 minutes prior to grilling.
I used butter instead of the oil. Stilll delious.

Took other reviewers advice and marinated asparagus in a zip loc with EVOO, balsamic vinegar, kosher salt and garlic powder for several hours. Roasted in 425 degree oven for about 15 minutes. Next time will try w/o vinegar and a little shorter time, maybe a bit less salt. Still delicious. Thanks for a great recipe from someone who hasn't cooked a lot of asparagus!
Very easy, but If youâ€™re looking for something even easier, cook it on a pan instead of grill. Tastes just as good. My family loved it!

I've made these before, but my daughter told me to try Italian salad dressing on them and I used a foil pack. They came out great. She grilled them with the dressing directly on the grill. Either way... it's now my favorite way to make and love asparagus.
Easy and delicious! I've made this twice in one week now.

Didn't read cooking time and left on the grill for around 10 or more minutes. They came out delicious. Maybe a little well done but I don't like my asparagus crunchy (al dente) anyway. So easy and tasted amazing!!

It was okay. The grilling time was far too short and it lacked flavor . I would up the oil to 2 tblspoons and add garlic powder and lemon for taste. I find asparagus to be something you need to grill as long as necessary until it is soft but still firm.
Simple, quick, and tasty.
Our grill must be too hot it almost over did the asparagus!

This was alright. It was raining the day I made it, so I had to use my oven. Broiled for 8 minutes on each side. It was okay, but I added garlic salt to it afterwards and that helped a bit. I'm not a huge fan of asparagus anyways, so I was hoping this would make it better.
I added 1 lb of sliced mushrooms,sesame seeds,& lemon juice
Simple and yummy.

Very good! My family loved it! The only change I made was to use lemon infused olive oil. I recommend the smiling olive mail order company online ordering for the high quality oil. I used my cast iron grill pan. I grilled it on high heat and kept turning it. Great results! I'll make it again.I used the left overs in ham, mushroom, asparagus quiche.

Use whatever seasonings that sound good (less is often more), and use thinner asparagus as they tend to be more crisp and not "woody". We remove from the grill while still fairly crunchy (our personal preference).
Perfect, perfect, perfect. Cooks to perfection.
Made this the other night, added some mushrooms, Parmesan, and garlic... tasted great!
I added the parmesan and lemon juice. My kids, who normally will not eat asparagus, liked it (they each ate 2 spears).
Turned out great. Easy!
This was very quick and easy to make. Will make again!
Quick and tasty. Man friendly vegetable dish.
It was wonderful and taste great. For season I used Garlic salt with parsley.
Easy to make, tasty, and healthy choice. What's not to like? I'll definitely use this recipe again.

This recipe was so easy. I thought about adding asparagus at the last minute and wanted something quick with ingredients that I would have on hand. It was delicious and will be a regular addition when grilling out.
Simple and delicious. Next time I think I will try altering the recipe with some of the other reviewers' suggestions.

It doesn't get any easier than this! I have a vegetable grill basket that sit's right on top of the grill. It makes it so easy to add your own seasonings' and flip over to cook the other side without losing any asparagus down in the grill.
Delicious! I used skewers as suggested in one of the reviews and cooked them on aluminum foil for the first 5-6 minutes then moved them directly to the grill for another 2-3 minutes.
This needed more than salt and pepper. I used some granulated garlic and oregano.
Loved it!
I just made it today and actually the whole family enjoyed it which was very unexpected
I made these and they were delicious. I did use some balsamic vinegar and marinated with the rest of the ingredients. Will make again!
EASY! I wrapped the asparagus in aluminum and used a little extra olive oil to put on the grill.
Delicious way for asparagus! I also put garlic and a little balsamic as the other reviews stated. My favorite way to serve this vegetable.
I've been doing this for years, and I can say that this is a perfect "go to" side for a variety of entrees that need a veggie. Pretty much a "simply throw it on the grill" type of side dish.
Excellent! My whole family LOVED it!

I have made this twice, the first time exactly as written, the second I added two cloves of garlic and let marinate couple hours. Both time delicious but will always use the garlic from now on. Yummy!
